revised_title: An Analysis of the Chinese Chronological Table and its Historical Accuracy
tldr: The author examines the various opinions on the origins and chronology of Chinese history, highlighting the inaccuracies and contradictions in the widely accepted chronology by Se ma T sien. The author argues that this chronology is based on unreliable sources and traditions, and contradicts the authority of Confucius and other ancient texts. Despite these flaws, the chronology remains widely accepted in China due to its association with a great name and its pleasing narrative style.
